==Club career== ===Early career=== Born in [[Sora, Lazio]], Zappacosta joined hometown's [[A.S. Sora|Sora]]'s youth setup in 1998, aged six, as a [[Forward (association football)|forward]].{{citation needed|date=September 2016}} In 2006–07 season, he was a player of Sora's under-15 team in Lazio Region Giovanissimi League.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.settoregiovanile.figc.it/REGIONALE/LAZIO/COM_UFF/2004/RG_CU55%20del%2010%20maggio%202007.pdf |title=Comunicato Ufficiale n.55 (2006–07) |trans-title=Official announcement n.55 (2006–07) |date=10 May 2007 |accessdate=19 October 2011 |publisher=FIGC Lazio |language=Italian |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120425080612/http://www.settoregiovanile.figc.it/REGIONALE/LAZIO/COM_UFF/2004/RG_CU55%20del%2010%20maggio%202007.pdf |archivedate=25 April 2012 |df=dmy }}</ref> In 2008, he moved to neighbouring [[A.C. Isola Liri|Isola Liri]], appearing in [[Campionato Nazionale Dante Berretti]] under-20's,<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.lega-calcio-serie-c.it/it/Comunic2010/Berretti/43TB.pdf|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120415073813/http://www.lega-calcio-serie-c.it/it/Comunic2010/Berretti/43TB.pdf|dead-url=yes|archive-date=15 April 2012|title=Comunicato Ufficiale n.43/TB (2009–10)|trans-title=Official announcement n.43/TB (2009–10)|date=25 November 2009|accessdate=19 October 2011|work=Campionato Berretti|publisher=Lega Calcio Serie C|language=Italian}}</ref> and made his senior debut for the side in the 2009–10 campaign; obtaining a total of 14 caps and one goal in the league.
===Atalanta=== In January 2011 Zappacosta joined [[Atalanta B.C.|Atalanta]] in a [[Co-ownership (football)|co-ownership deal]]<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.isolaliricalcio.it/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=233:mercato&catid=23:news&Itemid=19|title=Ceduto Davide Zappacosta|trans-title=Davide Zappacosta transferred|date=20 January 2011|accessdate=19 October 2011|publisher=A.C. Isola Liri|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120425080611/http://www.isolaliricalcio.it/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=233%3Amercato&catid=23%3Anews&Itemid=19|archivedate=25 April 2012|language=Italian|deadurl=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> for €60,000 transfer fee.<ref>Atalanta B.C. S.p.A. ''bilancio'' (financial report and accounts) on 31 December 2011, [http://www.registroimprese.it PDF purchased from Italian C.C.I.A.A.] (in Italian)</ref> He played for the [[Atalanta B.C. Primavera|Primavera]] for six months. He appeared during the pre-season with the main squad.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.atalanta.it/web/guest/live/-/articles/tag/prima+squadra/detail/article/21017/ |archive-url=https://archive.is/20120721005058/http://www.atalanta.it/web/guest/live/-/articles/tag/prima+squadra/detail/article/21017/ |dead-url=yes |archive-date=21 July 2012 |title=Quattordici reti in amichevole |date=28 July 2011 |accessdate=19 October 2011 |work=Atalanta BC |language=Italian }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.atalanta.it/live/-/articles/detail/article/46776 |title=Atalanta-Lumezzane 2–0 |date=3 August 2011 |accessdate=19 October 2011 |work=Atalanta BC |language=Italian |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110816082531/http://www.atalanta.it/live/-/articles/detail/article/46776 |archivedate=16 August 2011 |df=dmy }}</ref>
===Avellino=== On 31 August 2011, at age 19, he was signed by [[U.S. Avellino 1912|Avellino]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.asavellino.it/notizia.php?id=6049|title=L'attaccante Zappacosta dall'Atalanta all'Avellino|trans-title=Forward Zappacosta from Atalanta to Avellino|date=31 August 2011|accessdate=19 October 2011|publisher=A.S. Avellino 1912|language=Italian|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120508061354/http://www.asavellino.it/notizia.php?id=6049|archivedate=8 May 2012}}</ref> initially in temporary deal. The loan was turned into a co-ownership deal for €40,000 fee in 2012,<ref name=Atalanta2012bilancio/> after Atalanta bought him outright from Isola Liri for an undisclosed fee.<ref name=Atalanta2012bilancio>Atalanta B.C. S.p.A. ''bilancio'' (financial report and accounts) on 31 December 2012, [http://www.registroimprese.it PDF purchased from Italian C.C.I.A.A.] (in Italian)</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.legaseriea.it/c/document_library/get_file?p_l_id=58608&folderId=159875&name=DLFE-47629.pdf|title=Risoluzione Accordi di Partecipazione|date=23 June 2012|accessdate=25 June 2012|publisher=Lega Serie A|language=Italian|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130626172007/http://www.legaseriea.it/c/document_library/get_file?p_l_id=58608&folderId=159875&name=DLFE-47629.pdf|archivedate=26 June 2013}}</ref>
He played 3 seasons for Avellino, which the first two seasons in [[Lega Pro Prima Divisione]], winning the championship of the Group B of the third-tier in the [[2012–13 Lega Pro Prima Divisione|2012–13 season]] as well as crowded as [[Supercoppa di Lega Pro Prima Divisione|the grand champions]] after winning [[Trapani Calcio|Trapani]] of the Group A. After promotion to [[Serie B]] he decided to tattoo the date "05.05.2013".<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.gazzetta.it/Nazionale/03-09-2013/under-21-novita-zappacosta-dopo-avellino-voglio-a-201093311468.shtml |title=Under 21, la novitŕ č Zappacosta: "Dopo Avellino voglio la A" – La Gazzetta dello Sport |newspaper=La Gazzetta dello Sport |accessdate=6 July 2017}}</ref> The following year he scored a debut goal in Serie B in the match won 2–1 against [[Novara Calcio|Novara]], standing out as one of the best [[Left-back|full backs]] in the league.
===Return to Atalanta=== [[File:Davide Zappacosta.JPG|thumb|Zappacosta playing for Atalanta in 2014.]] On 4 June 2014 Zappacosta returned to [[Atalanta B.C.|Atalanta]] for €900,000 fee,<ref>Atalanta B.C. S.p.A. ''bilancio'' (financial report and accounts) on 31 December 2014, [http://www.registroimprese.it PDF purchased from Italian C.C.I.A.A.] (in Italian)</ref> signing a four-year deal.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://avellino.ottopagine.net/2014/06/03/esclusiva-ottopagine-zappacosta-torna-allatalanta/|title=Esclusiva – Zappacosta torna all'Atalanta: ecco le cifre|date=3 June 2014|accessdate=10 November 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141110174439/http://avellino.ottopagine.net/2014/06/03/esclusiva-ottopagine-zappacosta-torna-allatalanta/|archivedate=10 November 2014|deadurl=yes|publisher=Hurra Avellino|language=Italian|trans-title=Exclusive – Zappacosta returns to Atalanta: here are the numbers|df=dmy}}</ref> He made his official debut with [[Atalanta B.C.|Atalanta]] on 23 August 2014 against [[Pisa Calcio|Pisa]] in a 2–0 win in the third qualifying round of the [[2014–15 Coppa Italia|Coppa Italia]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2014/08/23/italy/coppa-italia/atalanta-bergamo/pisa-calcio/1904821/|title=Atalanta vs. Pisa – 23 August 2014|work=Soccerway|access-date=8 November 2017}}</ref> On 31 August 2014 Zappacosta made his debut in [[Serie A]], starting in a 0–0 home draw against [[Hellas Verona F.C.|Hellas Verona]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2014/08/31/italy/serie-a/atalanta-bergamo/hellas-verona-fc/1836099/|title=Atalanta vs. Hellas Verona – 31 August 2014|work=Soccerway|access-date=8 November 2017}}</ref> On 6 January 2015 he scored his first [[Serie A]] goal in the 37th minute of a 2–2 draw to [[Genoa C.F.C.|Genoa]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2015/01/06/italy/serie-a/genoa-cfc/atalanta-bergamo/1836425/|title=Genoa vs. Atalanta – 6 January 2015|work=Soccerway|access-date=8 November 2017}}</ref> On 11 January, one week later, he scored his second goal in the 72nd minute of a 1–1 home draw against [[A.C. Chievo Verona|Chievo Verona]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2015/01/11/italy/serie-a/atalanta-bergamo/ac-chievo-verona/1836439/|title=Atalanta vs. Chievo – 11 January 2015|work=Soccerway|access-date=8 November 2017}}</ref> On 8 February, Zappacosta scored his third goal of the season in the 9th minute of a 3–2 away defeat against [[ACF Fiorentina|Fiorentina]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2015/02/08/italy/serie-a/acf-fiorentina/atalanta-bergamo/1836519/|title=Fiorentina vs. Atalanta – 8 February 2015|work=Soccerway|access-date=8 November 2017}}</ref> He finished the 2014–15 season to [[Atalanta B.C.|Atalanta]] with 30 appearances, three goals and one assist.<ref name=Soccerway>{{Cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/davide-zappacosta/205625/|title=Italy – D. Zappacosta – Profile with news, career statistics and history|work=Soccerway|access-date=8 November 2017}}</ref>
===Torino=== On 10 July 2015 he was sold to [[Torino F.C.|Torino]], in the same transfer that brought the midfielder [[Daniele Baselli]] to [[Piedmont]], for a total of €10 million transfer fee.<ref>Torino F.C. S.p.A. ''bilancio'' (financial report and accounts) on 31 December 2015, [http://www.registroimprese.it PDF purchased from Italian C.C.I.A.A.] (in Italian)</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.gazzetta.it/Calciomercato/10-07-2015/torino-zappacosta-baselli-firmano-uffici-cairo-milano-120504564532.shtml|title=Torino, Zappacosta e Baselli hanno firmato|date=10 July 2015|newspaper =La Gazzetta dello Sport|access-date=1 September 2017 |language=Italian}}</ref> On 20 September, Zappacosta made his debut for Torino as a substitute replacing [[Bruno Peres]] in the 76th minute of a 2–0 home win over [[U.C. Sampdoria|Sampdoria]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2015/09/20/italy/serie-a/torino-fc/uc-sampdoria/2120414/|title=Torino vs. Sampdoria – 20 September 2015|work=Soccerway|access-date=8 November 2017}}</ref> He scored his first goal for the club on 28 October during a 3–3 draw at home to [[Genoa C.F.C.|Genoa]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2015/10/28/italy/serie-a/torino-fc/genoa-cfc/2120475/|title=Torino vs. Genoa – 28 October 2015|work=Soccerway|access-date=8 November 2017}}</ref> Zappacosta finished his first season to Torino with 26 appearances, one goal and one assist, and his second with 29 appearances, one goal and five assists.<ref name=Soccerway/>
===Chelsea=== [[File:West Brom 0 Chelsea 4 (6654549) (cropped).jpg|thumb|upright|Zappacosta playing for [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in 2017]]
On 31 August 2017, he was sold to [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] for a reported fee of €28 million plus bonuses.<ref>http://gianlucadimarzio.com/it/calciomercato-zappacosta-chelsea-le-cifre-delloperazione-e-la-foto-al-momento-della-firma</ref> He signed a four-year deal at [[Stamford Bridge (stadium)|Stamford Bridge]]. The transfer was completed minutes before the transfer window shut on deadline day.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2017/08/zappacosta-signs.html|title=Zappacosta signs –|date=31 August 2017|publisher=Chelsea F.C.}}</ref> Zappacosta made his debut for Chelsea on 9 September as a substitute replacing [[Victor Moses]] in the 74th minute of a 2–1 away win against [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2017/09/09/england/premier-league/leicester-city-fc/chelsea-football-club/2462828/|title=Leicester City vs. Chelsea – 9 September 2017|work=Soccerway|access-date=8 November 2017}}</ref> He made his [[UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] debut and scored his first goal for Chelsea on 12 September 2017, in a 6–0 home win against [[Qarabağ FK]]. With this goal, Zappacosta became the 100th Italian player to score a goal in the Champions League.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/Champions-League/12-09-2017/chelsea-che-perla-zappacosta-100-italiano-segno-champions-220534375187.shtml|title=Chelsea, che perla di Zappacosta! È il 100° italiano a segno in Champions|newspaper=La Gazzetta dello Sport|language=Italian |first=Luigi |last=Polce|date=12 September 2017|accessdate=12 September 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/09/12/chelsea-6-qarabag-0-davide-zappacosta-marks-full-debut-goal/|title=Chelsea 6 Qarabag 0: Davide Zappacosta marks full debut with goal as half-strength hosts run riot|newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |first=Matt |last=Law|date=12 September 2017|accessdate=12 September 2017}}</ref> His first [[English Premier League|Premier League]] goal came from outside the box in a 5–0 home win against [[Stoke City]] on 30 December 2017.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/dec/30/chelsea-stoke-premier-league-match-report|title=Chelsea's Davide Zappacosta completes crushing of dire Stoke|work=The Guardian|date=31 December 2017}}</ref>
==International career== During his period in [[Irpinia]], he made his debut with the Italy [[Italy national under-21 football team|under-21]] on 5 September 2013 in a [[2015 UEFA European Under-21 Championship]] [[2015 UEFA European Under-21 Championship qualification|qualifier match]] against [[Belgium national under-21 football team|Belgium]], losing 3–1. He also received a call-up from [[Italy under-21 Serie B representative team]] against a team of free agent that was trained in a camp held by [[Italian Footballers' Association]], in August 2013.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.legab.it/fileadmin/user_upload/newscms/doc/14366941177908.pdf|title=B ITALIA-RAPPRESENTATIVA AIC SENZA CONTRATTO MERCOLEDi' A COVERCIANO|date=5 August 2013|access-date=2 September 2016|publisher=Lega Serie B|language=Italian|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160915031719/http://www.legab.it/fileadmin/user_upload/newscms/doc/14366941177908.pdf|archivedate=15 September 2016|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
He took part in the [[2015 UEFA European Under-21 Championship|2015]] [[UEFA European Under-21 Championship]] in the Czech Republic, playing as a starter in the right full-back position in all three of Italy's games, who were eliminated in the group stage.<ref>{{cite web|title=Under-21 2015 – England-Italy – UEFA|url=http://www.uefa.com/under21/season=2015/matches/round=2000408/match=2015378/index.html|publisher=UEFA|accessdate=25 June 2015}}</ref>
In May 2016, Zappacosta was called up to the [[Italy national football team|senior national team]] by coach [[Antonio Conte]] in preparation for the [[UEFA Euro 2016]]. He was subsequently included in the list of 30 provisional players for the tournament.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sportmediaset.mediaset.it/calcio/Nazionale/benassi-e-zappacosta-coro-pro-ventura-sarebbe-ottimo-ct-_1099324-201602a.shtml |title=Benassi e Zappacosta, coro pro-Ventura: "Sarebbe ottimo ct" – Sportmediaset |website=Sportmediaset.mediaset.it |date=20 May 2016 |accessdate=6 July 2017}}</ref> On 31 May, he was named one of three reserves for the senior side for Euro 2016.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.football-italia.net/85180/rugani-azzurri-reserves|title=Rugani in Azzurri reserves|publisher=Football Italia|date=31 May 2016|accessdate=31 May 2016}}</ref>
He made his international debut for Italy on 12 November 2016, against [[Liechtenstein national football team|Liechtenstein]] in a [[2018 World Cup qualifying]] match, starting the match as a right back.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/matches/round=276483/match=300332067/index.html#nosticky |title=2018 FIFA World Cup Russia™ – Matches – Liechtenstein-Italy |publisher=FIFA |date=23 June 2017 |accessdate=6 July 2017}}</ref>
